Golden Sands Hotel Apartments
7.3 Very good
Based on 1512 reviews

I arrived well behind schedule, about four hours later than I was supposed to arrive and the staff greeted me warmly and took good care of me.

There was some confusion at first because there are several Golden Sands buildings and my reservation said building 5 but My room was really in building 3. I was a little put off because they made it seem like I made a mistake when my reservation clearly said building 5. I was in the correct building shortly after, but at 2am anything can seem like a bigger deal than it actually is, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. I was not aware that they would take a 300 AED deposit, but that was not that big of a deal. What was a big deal was when I was checking in, they told me the deposit would be released immediately and checking out I was told it would take seven days. Basically they need to get their staff all on the same page and do some customer service training. I'll stress though, that these were small things and the staff was quite pleasant overall. The room was fantastic and with a living room, kitchen and washer/dryer, I could have spent a few weeks here and had all the comforts of home. It's not located that close to the newer parts of Dubai or the Burj Khalifa, but that's all a short taxi ride away. There was a close metro station, however, and old Dubai, which is very charming, is quite close, too. If I came to Dubai again, I would absolutely stay here and not look anywhere else.

Show more
Nicholas , United States
Shangri-La Hotel Dubai
8.7 Excellent
Based on 625 reviews

We started our stay in Dubai at this hotel for the first two nights and then transferred to the IBIS Mall of the Emirates.

Compared to the room at the IBIS, this hotel was great, but as a value in itself, it definitely doesn't feel like a $300 a night hotel. The location is nice. It's a 10 minute walk to the metro station. Then you take one stop to the Emirates Mall station. From the station to the mall is a 15 minute walk through an air conditioned corridor. The hotel is walking distance to coffee shops and "Zait wa Zaatar" which is a really good breakfast and lunch restaurant with arabic food. The room is spacious and clean. The bathroom is also spacious and nice. There's nothing bad I can say about the hotel, except I probably wouldn't stay there again just for the price. Since you have to take taxis everywhere anyway, you can find a nice hotel a little farther away.

Show more
Omar , United States
AVANI Deira Dubai Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 416 reviews

We stayed in Moevenpick Deira for 3 days in august 2012. We stayed in a deluxe room. The room was quite good.

Big enough with good features like a good television, fast internet, simple design and a nice bathroom. The service in the hotel was excellent. The responsetime (questions, laundry, luggage) was fast. The pool is somewhat small and can get crowded. The gym however is excellent. Sufficient equipment, clean and more than enough space for exercise. We didn't have the chance to eat at the restaurant, but the breakfast was good. Lots of choice and nice variation. I don't like muffins , but the blueberry muffins there were killer. The location of the hotel isn't too bad. However, taxi's in dubai are relatively cheap so transport shouldn't be a problem. Another plus for this hotel is Oceana Beach Club. We loved it there! Nice, cool and big swimming pool next to a good restaurant. right on the Palm with a great view. Our conclusion is that we had great value. We will definitely come back.

Show more
Dennis , Netherlands
StarMetro Deira Hotel Apartments
7.6 Very good
Based on 1417 reviews

I have tried different hotels during my vacation in Dubai and this is my least favorite. PROS: air-conditioning is good, near metro, near supermarkets, opposite reef mall, plenty of kitchen utensils on default, room smells good as soon as you come in, hotel hallway smells good, concierge is okay CONS: no visitors allowed in the room even just for a few hours like dinner (major turnoff, not indicated on the website), reception does not greet, we bookes for two and room provisions are only for 1 even after the first day and requesting multiple times.

They keep on arranging the room and putting toiletries for 1. Requested for towel but have to call twice. Kitchen - electric stove, only one is working Light atop the stove is not working According to website, separate shower room and tub but that is not the case Tub too small Description from site not that accurate in real life. I could go back as a lastrl resort but not as long as there are other nice hotels near the metro.

Show more
Lyn , Philippines
Carlton Palace Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 853 reviews

When you see all the photos of various famous people who have stayed here it almost feels like an endorsement of the hotel.

The walls are decorated with pictures of (among others) Bruce Willis; Venus Williams; Sylvester Stallone; Cindy Crawford; Patrick Swayze and Wesley Snipes, along with various dignitaries from all over the world. This is a beautiful hotel. We were greeted very warmly by reception staff. We had arrived on an early morning flight and came to leave cases in reception. We were told they would try to have our room ready by 12 o’clock. When this wasn’t possible we were given an upgrade to a beautiful room. The room was spotless and beautifully decorated. The hotel was well placed for sightseeing and shopping. Public transport around the city and to the airport is convenient. We only stayed here for one night on our way to Vietnam and we would happily recommend it to anyone.

Show more
Gerard , Ireland
Shangri-La Dubai Apartments
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 34 reviews

Park Regis Kris Kin Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 608 reviews

The view of Sheikh Zayed Road is only available on Executive rooms and have to pay for upgrade. Best of luck trying to kill time and sleeping in the lobby if your flight arrives before 2 pm as they don't allow early check in.

Rude staff, have to phone room service a few times if your running low on the amenities provided. There is a night club on 3rd floor which has very loud music and can be heard on the lower level hotel rooms so if your with a family make sure you ask for high.

Show more
Imran , United Kingdom
The H Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 307 reviews

Im a fan of the H Hotel. A very nice hotel and Im used to live in it when I go to Dubai for shopping purposes or business.

I love the food within the Room Service. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The only thing which I would point at is the valet parking of the hotel, as they are too slow although the hotel is not busy. I hope that the hotel speed up when in comes to vallet parking service. This however can be overcomed if you call the Concierge from the room in advance before leaving. Other than that, the hotel is excellent.

Show more
HUMAID , United Arab Emirates
City Premiere Marina Hotel Apartments
8.1 Excellent
Based on 298 reviews

I stayed here with my two children in a 1bedrm apt and was very disappointed. The apartment size was good and view of Marina was nice but very few rooms would have a view.

We paid for a deluxe room to have Marina views. Wifi was helpful also. Unfortunately the service was lacking. Extremely lacking. Website states they have complimentary shuttle to mall, this is also in the "hotel info" book in the room. This was a key point as to why I booked here. But there was no shuttle. I was told to walk to the metro rail station (with 2 young children in middle of summer!). Try to order room service or eat in the hotel restaurant/cafe or order food drinks at the pool, and you can't put the bill on the room you must pay for it at the time. Annoying to say the least. In addition to that, the breakfast we ordered on the first day,omelette, was disgusting. Did not eat in the hotel again. Finally, we had friends staying in Dubai at the same time. After a day out sightseeing with them, we planned to head back to our apartment for a while and then head out for dinner. I was shocked to be told that we could not have visitors in the apartment!!! How ridiculous! I eventually asked to speak with the manager and was told they would 'make an exception'. Awful treatment of a guest. We were planning to sit by the pool the next day and order lunch but obviously decided against that after the ordeal. The staff were very unhelpful. I asked for late checkout on last day as our flight was at 10pm, they offered 2pm checkout. Thanks for nothing. Had to waste 6hrs with 2 children. The hotel was far from being full. I would never stay here again, or at any other City Premiere establishment and would not recommend staying there to anyone who wants to have an enjoyable holiday experience.

Show more
Kym , Australia
DAMAC Maison Dubai Mall Street
7.5 Very good
Based on 250 reviews

I found this hotel to be way too expensive in its current state. I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the Dubai Mall.

It was a little pricy but I figured it was worth a try. I was very disappointed to find out that the mall which sits approximately 100 Yards from the hotel is basicly unaccessible. The hotel is currently surrounded on 3 sides by major construction sites, even the road used to access the hotel is temporary. The hotel does provide an hourly shuttle service to the mall, but because of the poorly designed road system in the area, it takes approximately 15 minutes to reach the mall that as I said earlier is about 100 yards away! There is a way to walk to the mall if you are willing to trec through the sand around the construction site. I realize that this hotel has no control over all of the construction around it, but I feel they should be doing more to provide a temporary lighted walkway to the areas main attraction! I'm sure this will be a great hotel in a few years once all of the construction is completed around it.

Show more
David , United States
dusitD2 kenz hotel dubai
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 104 reviews

Wow, just wow, it was really a great experience staying in this hotel, we stayed for 7days and 6nights, they do deserved a five stars on everything, from the cleanliness, everything is just soo clean,tidy and so new, ot smells so good the moment you get into the hotel lobby, even their common toilet at the lobby look sick, it has towels it was clean, it has relaxing instrumental music playing in the background, the location is sooo perfect, its like 3mins walk to dubai internet city metro station, so you can go around anywhere using the metro, which is really good and cheap instead of taking taxi's and uber.

The hotel is at the reasonable price too, worth it. And the staff are just so nice and hospitable and approachable, especially ms. Lois and mr. Zakir. As for the breakfast we did not avail it, since we did not want to eat same buffet breakfast for one week just in case. But we did tried it once, it was okay, not so great though. And the amenities are quite good too, except for the pool which is a little bit small, but it was also okay since its not too deep. So it is safe. Well, i will surely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and if given the chance to visit dubai in the future, we will surely check in this hotel again. Thanks.

Show more
hazel , Saudi Arabia
Carlton Downtown Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 460 reviews

My first nite there was an nightmare. The room next to me was playing the music so loud, I called the reception they sent up the security staff,he heard the noise, knocked on my door and asked me to wait with my door opened, then he knocked onto that noisy room door, the guest opened it, he told the guest that I complained about the noise by pointing at my direction.

Is it the proper way to handle a guest's noise complain? asking the 2 guests to face each other? After that, the next room did lower down the music, but an hour later the music started again. Around 5am in the morning, I heard the security staff knocked on the next door again, obviously I'm not the only one who complained (cuz this time it is not me who called the reception). But I think the next door guest was sleeping with the music on, so nobody answered the door this time and they just let the musice continued till I called the reception at 7am and req for a room change. The 2nd day I hold a different reservation with a 2 bedrms suite, and I didn't get my room till 1pm, obviously the hotel didn't care abt the complaint I made the nite b4 and they didn't care if the guests had a sleepless nite or what. They didn't even try to offer a room change till I requested one. As for the 2 bedrooms suite, it looks better than the 1 bedroom suite, a little bit cleaner and newer, but still, there re only 2 cups and 1 hair dryer in the room.This suite is supposed to accomodate 4 ppl, I think it makes sense if the hotel can put 4 sets of amenities and 2 hair dryers in each room. The staff of the hotel is ok, not really very friendly or helpful but not rude though. The hotel rooms are also ok, a bit old but with this price, it is acceptable. Therefore, don't expect too much as everything is just ok.

Show more
Ka , Hong Kong
Armani Hotel Dubai
8.9 Excellent
Based on 225 reviews

As soon as one steps onto the grounds of the Armani Hotel at Burj Khalifa he is treated to a world of modern elegance and attentive service.

A stay at this establishment will cost more than that at most other hotels but is in my opinion well worth it. First of all, everyone knows you don't really walk anywhere in Dubai, but from the entrance of the Armani Hotel you CAN actually walk to the Dubai Mall - one of the biggest attractions in the surrounding neighborhood. The advantages of this simple convenience cannot be overstated since the Dubai Mall will provide a visitor with everything from shopping, meals, banking services, to the entrance to the top of Burj Khalifa observation deck. Secondly, the hotel is located really pretty much at the activity center of Dubai with anywhere one needs to go within a 30 minute taxi ride. This of course does not include Jebel Ali port and some of the other outlying industrial areas. There are some minor issues with the interior details and finishes of choice not being able to withstand the test of time and use but unfortunately that's just how some of these high design establishments end up, all things considered the public areas and rooms, along with the attentive service staff, treats a visitor to a temporary and memorable escape from the vulgar and garish world around.

Show more
Bennett , United States
Dukes Dubai
8.9 Excellent
Based on 50 reviews

Got to the Hotel early,but could not accommodate with an earlier check-in,although they were emailed 3 times and told the trip was for a special birthday.

Being such a big hotel you would have considered something but no only wanted to give an apartment in their sister hotel next door at a price of an extra £200 per night. Finally go the room just before 3pm,we got to the hotel at 7am ,9 hrs in lobby. The 'icing on the cake' was they aged my wife by 5 years when we received our complimentary cup cake which was chocolate and in the email my son wrote had categorically told them we were allergic to chocolate. All in all the conscierge staff were very helpful but the Managers had an attitude.

Show more
Parmar , United Kingdom
Al Khoory Atrium
8.7 Excellent
Based on 479 reviews

Staff members are highly professional and very guest-friendly. They welcomed us and made us feel like we were at home.

I remebered that when we had our breakfast, the chef himself-- I think he was of Yemani heritage-- talked to us and asked us of what we wish to have for breakfast. Other memebers too were resposive and very welcoming. An Indian staff chatted with us in the restaurant at the lobby and generosly added some portion of ice cream. These small gestures have created an extremely positive impression of the staff in particular and the hotel management team at large. The location is close to shops and the mall of the Emirates. Taxis are always at the front door. You can get what you need during your stay. The hotel room is unbelievably impressive: spacious, very mdern, equipped with the latest technology. The price is excellent giving all these features! It offers a five-star service! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Show more
Arfat , Oman
Gloria Hotel & Apartments Dubai
8 Very good
Based on 560 reviews

It was good overall. The concierge service was commendable - they were very helpful & friendly, especially Gabriel (the big guy).

Improvement needed on the furniture as it looked rather worn out and the balcony which was dusty (inside the rooms itself are clean though). Also, at point of check in, the receptionist could had been more helpful as we were tired due to long journey & flight delayed. We waited for some time and we were told that the key cards would be given only the next day. No proper explanation was given. We were wandering how we could keep the air-cons & lights on if there was no key card. Fortunately, the concierge guy who took our luggages up to the room offered help and he managed to get us the key cards. He was good & helpful but didn't get his name. Overall, it was still a pleasant stay. Great if the hotel could look into some of the feedback shared.

Show more
Sherene , Malaysia
Ramada Downtown Dubai
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1217 reviews

Stayed here the second time and once again felt extremely well. The staff are very friendly, which makes a big difference for me.

The rooms are very spacious with a kitchen and refrigerator. Large and comfortable beds. flatscreen TV and desk. Iron/ironing board in the room. spacious bathroom with shower and bathtub (separated). I was "upgraded" to a lake view, which was nice. It was a low floor though, but i could still see a bit of the fountain show and the Burj Khalifa. Breakfast has a good selection of cold cuts, egg cooking station and other warm dishes. It was November and the weather was not too hot, so i had breakfast on the terrace, which was nice. The area is great for running although being right in the middle of downtown. I went for morning runs (before sunrise) and it was a perfect addition to the gym. The gym is a bit hard to find and complicated to get to. First you need to get a key card for the gate on the terrace of the second floor (you'll get that card in the breakfast room). The gym is in the other (residential) tower. Once you're there there is no clear indication of where the gym is. By luck I noticed that I have to take the elevator down one floor and then turn right coming out of the elevator. This could be a little bit more user-friendly. The gym is fairly-well equipped with different workout machines, running machines and free weights. I also saw personal trainers there. I also love the location of this hotel, which is a stone-throw away from numerous restaurants (e.g. in the souk) and of course Dubai Mall, which is massive. Will definitely come back here next time I am in Dubai.

Show more
Florian , Germany
Jumeira Rotana Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 210 reviews

We would definitely recommend this hotel if visiting Dubai, lots of great facilities including three restaurants (all serving alcohol) We really loved the Boston Bar for a great pub/bar atmosphere with good tasty food.

The pool area was lovely, and the pool staff very helpful. Our room was fantastic, excellent standards and the decoration was good, we loved having the extra space for our long stay and the dining table for a couple of in room dinners. Both room service and housekeeping were faultless. If I had one criticism it would be the Wifi, stated wifi in the classic suite but does not explain there was a charge. The hotel did give us a 20% discount on the price but we did have to push to get that, also it only allows you to connect 2 devices. In this modern world of technology we had two devices each, but the hotel said they would have to charge us twice if we wanted all four connected. We were very disappointed by this and although it seems wifi in Dubai is expensive and very rarely free, (a few mall and coffee shops) it is a shame this hotel group cannot stand out for the crowd with a great offer for their hotel guests. Overall this did not spoil our stay, the hotel was lovely and the staff are very well trained and are exceptional in their helpful and friendly manner.

Show more
Shelley , United Kingdom
Wyndham Dubai Marina
8.2 Excellent
Based on 145 reviews

This is the friendliest Hotel I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. The staff are a credit to the Hotel and Management.

We didn't get off to the best start. We had a catalogue of small errors. After pointing out our concerns to the Management they promptly took action and ensured we were happy. This to me is the measure of a good Hotel and Management. We had the most beautiful room on the 31st floor with access to the Club Lounge. Cooked breakfast is available in the Club Lounge and is much quieter and more relaxing than the main dining room which can be very busy. Soft drinks and Hot beverages are available all day in the Club room as well as snacks and drinks including alcohol in the evening ( Happy Hour is 6-9 pm with all drinks free of charge) I highly recommend paying the extra charge for this facility. I would like to see more hot food and cold meats etc included in the evening snacks and I think the Hotel has to improve this if they wish to compete with other Hotels offering this service. Apart from that the Hotel definitely has a winning formula and would be top of my list if I return to Dubai. Special mention to Mr Erhard... The Bonnington is located at the newer end of Dubai (when coming from the airport it is a 30 minute taxi ride) in the Jumeirah Towers area - a combination of business offices and residences and hotels.

Room service has an average 20-25 minute completion time, but the food is good (although chef needs to relook at the Eggs Benedict - yolk should be runny, not fully cooked). Its a 20 minute taxi ride to Downtown (Mall of Dubai, etc.) but closer to the Marina Mall and other places like JBR Walk. If in Dubai for business or leisure, the Bonnington provides a decent place for the night (with pub and bar) to relax, after spending the day in Downtown or work. While I am not sure what the original rates are, the Agoda rate I received was truly deserving of the hotel. Staff at the hotel are very helpful and ensure you are engaged in a personal manner (using your name rather than just Sir or Maam). Full commendation to them and the management. Carpet seemed to be a little old as well as the furnishings. We requested a room up high and they put us on the 6th floor. I guess I should have asked for a room that requires oxygen when you are in it. There was nothing special about the rooms. I would not stay here again just because I don't think the price they are asking is worth it. The next time I will go to the Atlantis. We went there for the day and went swimming with the dolphins and the hotel was really nice. There was plenty of different options for food and was affordable. The only downside to staying there is if you are wanting to go into Dubai it will probably cost you at a minimum of 50 AED per person. Again the hotel was nice but well over priced.

David , United States
JA Jebel Ali Beach Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 100 reviews

I would not stay at this resort again. The main reason is that on our first day there, we took a walk around the grounds and came upon the stables and just next to this their 'animal corner'.

This animal corner was basically a mini zoo, but with animals trapped in very small enclosures. A whole lot of goats with absolutely nothing to do in one small enclosure, some bunnies, ducks, chickens and then a camel in a very small space. This camel was crying out and screaming and thrashing and showing signs of enormous distress. I noticed his face was streaked with what looked like tears. At first I thought it couldn't be tears, it must be water from dipping his face in his water bowl, but all other signs pointed to his distress. We took a photo and back in the hotel room it was absolutely obvious that these were tear streaks. Looking it up online I discovered that yes, camels do cry, big human emotional tears. It was very upsetting to see such evidence of animals in distress and kept in cages like this. There were also lots of peacocks roaming free, beautiful ones which was lovely to see, but what was NOT lovely then was to see waiters throwing stones at the peacocks to get them away from the diners in the restaurant. As an animal lover, this was all horrific to me, and blighted what would have been a lovely weekend. I would not stay there again, as I do not support animal cruelty in any form. On the plus side, service was good, the surrounds are very pretty and there is a lot to do. The room was very small and poky though, and the food prices very high. I have no problem paying high prices when that translates to excellent food, but in this case it was soup that really seemed like it was from a can, and noodles that seemed very similar to 2 minute noodles served in a very pricey Thai restaurant. So all in all, it was not the standard I would have expected.

It was really a nice and charming place to stay in Dubai a stark contrast from the skyscraper hotels in downtown.

You really get to have a sense of place and culture in Barjeel guesthouse. It is located along the row of traditional houses of the early settlers along the Dubai creek. Also a really a big plus is its proximity to the metro station and bus station,even if you are just sleep walking from your hotel room you'll get to the nearest station. ;p There are souks nearby which is nice to check out,plenty of interesting and traditional finds. Plenty of good eating places that are inexpensive but good. Their rooms are just soo charming and cozy its very spacious. The traditional furniture pieces really add to the experience. Its far enough from the street so you wont hear any vehicular noise but very near the creek which is nice to stroll along specially during night time. The breakfast was ok,just enough to have something in your tummy but please dont expect much. We stayed for 7 nights and 8 days and we truly enjoyed our stay in Barjeel. Even my friend who lives in Dubai was surprised with that charming place she never expected something like it along with its inexpensive rate she even wanted to stay there for a night. Though i have read some reviews that it was a bit tricky to find. We were lucky our cab driver knew where it was. I would definitely stay there again if we visit dubai again and would definitely recommend it. The friendly and accomodating staff Erol and Wyclef were a plus in making our stay hassle free.

Dubai is the most lively city in the Gulf. It is great for restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. It is not cheap but if you live in a nearby country, it is worth an occasional visit.

Also, it has many different kinds of people there - visitors and denizens.

More about Dubai

With soaring skyscrapers, massive artificial islands, and the only seven-star hotel in the world, Dubai is certainly a city that consistently redefines luxury. The Burj Khalifa has secured this city's status as a global trend-setter, and at nearly half a mile tall and shattering every world record, it is of course the tallest building in the world.

Besides luxury accommodation, Dubai is also home to world-class shopping inside some of the most decadent shopping centers in the world. The Dubai Shopping Festival is held during the first two months of the year, and the shopping malls and local markets offer promotions to encourage shoppers.

West of the gleaming heights of modern Dubai are Bur Dubai and Deira, historic districts straddling Dubai Creek, where life still reflects some of traditional Dubai. Several of the best hotels in Dubai are housed here in heritage buildings along the creek and around the wharf, with water taxis ferrying passengers between sites like the Bastakiya historic quarter and the Dubai Museum.

Dubai International Airport is the busiest travel hub in the Middle East, and it ushers an ever-growing number of tourists into Dubai each year.

I was in the correct building shortly after, but at 2am anything can seem like a bigger deal than it actually is, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. I was not aware that they would take a 300 AED deposit, but that was not that big of a deal. What was a big deal was when I was checking in, they told me the deposit would be released immediately and checking out I was told it would take seven days. Basically they need to get their staff all on the same page and do some customer service training. I'll stress though, that these were small things and the staff was quite pleasant overall. Iron/ironing board in the room. spacious bathroom with shower and bathtub (separated). I was "upgraded" to a lake view, which was nice. I went for morning runs (before sunrise) and it was a perfect addition to the gym. The gym is a bit hard to find and complicated to get to. First you need to get a key card for the gate on the terrace of the second floor (you'll get that card in the breakfast room). The gym is in the other (residential) tower. Once you're there there is no clear indication of where the gym is. By luck I noticed that I have to take the elevator down one floor and then turn right coming out of the elevator. This could be a little bit more user-friendly. The gym is fairly-well equipped with different workout machines, running machines and free weights. I also saw personal trainers there. I also love the location of this hotel, which is a stone-throw away from numerous restaurants (e.g. in the souk) and of course Dubai Mall, which is massive. The pool area was lovely, and the pool staff very helpful. Our room was fantastic, excellent standards and the decoration was good, we loved having the extra space for our long stay and the dining table for a couple of in room dinners. Both room service and housekeeping were faultless. If I had one criticism it would be the Wifi, stated wifi in the classic suite but does not explain there was a charge. This animal corner was basically a mini zoo, but with animals trapped in very small enclosures. A whole lot of goats with absolutely nothing to do in one small enclosure, some bunnies, ducks, chickens and then a camel in a very small space. This camel was crying out and screaming and thrashing and showing signs of enormous distress. I noticed his face was streaked with what looked like tears. At first I thought it couldn't be tears, it must be water from dipping his face in his water bowl, but all other signs pointed to his distress. We took a photo and back in the hotel room it was absolutely obvious that these were tear streaks. Looking it up online I discovered that yes, camels do cry, big human emotional tears. It was very upsetting to see such evidence of animals in distress and kept in cages like this. There were also lots of peacocks roaming free, beautiful ones which was lovely to see, but what was NOT lovely then was to see waiters throwing stones at the peacocks to get them away from the diners in the restaurant. As an animal lover, this was all horrific to me, and blighted what would have been a lovely weekend. I would not stay there again, as I do not support animal cruelty in any form. On the plus side, service was good, the surrounds are very pretty and there is a lot to do. The room was very small and poky though, and the food prices very high. I have no problem paying high prices when that translates to excellent food, but in this case it was soup that really seemed like it was from a can, and noodles that seemed very similar to 2 minute noodles served in a very pricey Thai restaurant. So all in all, it was not the standard I would have expected. Show more Jaye , South Africa Le Meridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort and Marina Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 6 reviews Park Hyatt Hotel Dubai 8.9 Excellent Based on 77 reviews Impressed from moment of arrival. Warmly welcomed by reception team, baggage handled effortlessly by female porters, given room upgrade and complimentary breakfast without asking. Room overlooked the river and was superbly spacious and well equipped.After a late evening swim in the romantically lit outdoor heated pool enjoyed an excellent nights sleep in a comfortable king size bed. Breakfast was outstanding with cooked dishes served to our table.We took the hotel private car to the airport which was same price as local taxis. Show more harold , United Kingdom Jumeirah Dar Al Masyaf - Madinat Jumeirah 9.5 Exceptional Based on 50 reviews Stayed here in January with my wife and 4 year old boy. Booked on agoda and was expecting to have free access to the water park as described on e website. Paid $800USD for a room to find out the water park was closed (annual maintenance). Very disappointing that agoda didn't update their information as I would have booked elsewhere. Hotel was very understanding and provided us with a room upgrade, offered to send us to Atlantis water park as a replacement, offered free breakfast and free drinks for 4 people at dinner which we had at Pierchic (high end seafood restaurant). Can't complain about how they turned things around fand went out of their way to offer customer satisfaction. Great stuff. Hotel is extremely vast and beautiful. Beach is the nicest in Dubai and reserved for patrons of the hotel only. Food at Pierchic was spectacular, and priced within reason for the food you get. Overall, I would rate this property as a 5*. The way they handled our situation is commendable and an example to follow for all hotels. Show more Patrice , Canada The Westin Dubai Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina 8.9 Excellent Based on 35 reviews Just had 8 nights at Westin where we booked an Executive Room with a sea view. We selected a rate inclusive of buffet breakfast and that proved to be a great choice - a huge range of dishes at Blue Orange or a smaller choice in the Executive Lounge but both very good quality. Really liked the overall relaxed ambience and the feeling of space in the hotel extending both to the outside areas around the pools and the beach plus the rooms themselves where beds were very comfortable and the rooms well equipped and very quiet. Staff exceptionally polite, helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Some may find the location not as convenient as staying on the main drag on JBR but the noise and traffic factors offset that and it's still only a short distance away in any event. Have stayed at many hotels in Dubai on multiple visits - very happy at having chosen Westin this time and my wife and I definitely plan on visiting again. Show more Andrew , United Kingdom JA Palm Tree Court 8.2 Excellent Based on 32 reviews My stay was fine except for few things that was not professionally handled by hotel staff (Reception and Room Service). For the receptionists they look like not well trained to handle under work pressure, for few clients are checking in/checking out at the same time they where not in focus that some mistakes happened in paper work/credit card payments with poor correction actions. While checking in I requested for a next day late check out which has been confirmed in spot to suddenly be asked next day to check-out early without enough time to pack my things up. I requested buggy service couple of times to pick me up from my suite to the lobby/restaurant but their response was so slow that I had to wait 30mins. While checking out I have been asked to pay for my stay again while I already paid through online booking which delays my checking out to verify that. I have been in most of the world's beautiful resorts/hotels and I have platinum and golden membership in most of them but as poor service as I got in Palm Tree makes me think twice before coming back again. One reason may let me come back is the location and the beach, nothing else. Show more Mohamed , United Arab Emirates Jumeirah Zabeel Saray 8.1 Excellent Based on 5 reviews The Ritz Carlton Dubai 8.7 Excellent Based on 37 reviews Great rooms - spacious and comfortable although perhaps a little outdated. The outside area is great for younger children with a play area and childrens pool with slide (lots of fun!) and waterfall feature. A little less enjoyable for the adults though as there is not that much room for a proper swim. They could do with a larger pool which I think they are in the process of building anyway. The beach was lovely although a little scruffy in places but the water seemed super-clean. The pool cafe was excellent - the food was served very quickly and was really fresh and varied. Not too badly prices either although alcoholic drinks are more pricey as you would expect. Overall a lovely break and would return once the development is finished. Oh and the gym facilities are amazing! Show more Emma , United Kingdom Le Royal Meridien Beach Resort and Spa Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 60 reviews This hotel was very comfortable. Although the rooms were old in decor they have been very well kept and felt homely. The facilities at the hotel were fantastic with three pools to choose from, an endless supply of sun loungers, grass areas to play games and a private beach area for guests. The hotel staff were very accommodating to all of our needs. Their approach to service was of a very high standard. We had a small baby and everything was on hand for him - baby seat in the hotel car that collected us from the airport, cot, steriliser in the room, additional water - nothing was too much trouble. Food was expensive (but then so is any hotel food). We would definitely stay there again. Show more Kate , Australia Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Resort 7.6 Very good Based on 25 reviews How this is a 5 star hotel I just don't understand , the bathroom condition is a joke so old fashioned , water pressure is so Rubbish , water starts to get cold after 2-3 showers , had cockroaches in our room , staff at the pool are so rude and bad mannered , told my kids they not allowed to play in the kids pool twice and luckily I was there the second time and gave the lifeguard a nice earful then he apologised , telling my kids not to make noise , they are under 6 and on holiday . Wifi not free in the room come on why hotels still charging for wifi I don't understand . Staff asked for 300 aed per night to upgrade which I decided to go ahead with then the other staff at the reception spoke in there language and my price suddenly changed from 300 to 5 per night , I then got angry and told him that your trying to cheat now and told him to just give me my original booking , he apologised and came back down to 300 . why is Dubai all about rinsing people ok for the rich but for the average person it's not good . Location of the hotel is good but not the best as it's still a good walk away from the beach and shops , pool area is great but the sun gets blocked at times by double tree Hilton which is a very big building facing Sheraton . Show more Naeem , United Kingdom Residence & Spa, Dubai at One&Only Royal Mirage 9.4 Exceptional Based on 57 reviews Four Seasons Resort Dubai at Jumeirah Beach 9.3 Exceptional Based on 9 reviews XVA Art Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 141 reviews Entering XVA felt like being a house guest in an artist's abode. Interesting art works were everywhere. The room where we stayed was small but the bed was comfortable. The size of the bathroom was okay. The room seemed to be designed by an experienced and hospitable hotelier- it's not huge but it anticipated all my needs. There were enough clothes hangers, there was even a crisp, cotton/linen bathrobe. I was surprised to find an interesting collection of books in the room and some of my favorite magazines (like a recent issue of The New Yorker!) so I didn't mind not having a TV. There was wifi signal everywhere. And because it had only a few rooms we normally had breakfast alone in the courtyard with chirping birds as companion. The staff was friendly, courteous and efficient (it did help that a number of them were Filipinos like me but we are raised to be hospitable so that's no surprise :D). XVA is also walking distance from the Dubai museum and a few minutes from the old souk where shopping was quite enjoyable. It was also a water taxi ride away from the gold and spice souk (we were told)but we didn't have the time to go to these two other souks.I can't imagine staying anywhere else if I ever get the chance to go back to Dubai. XVA is home. Show more Irma , Philippines Ahmedia Heritage Guesthouse 8.2 Excellent Based on 156 reviews My flight was arived 1:30am,hotel's driver was hold a sign with my name waiting at exit, for alone travner like me later night get in a new country, is good have somebody you can trust shows up. The driver had very good manner, and verywarmth. While we arrived the rod near the hotel, the stuff was waiting outside already. He helped me carry my luggages,and order breakfast for next morning. The stuff are very polite too. Hotel room is Arab staly, furniture are tradition looking too. I woke up by prayers in the morning 6am. The bed was ok comfortable, but bath towel are soft and nice. I enjoyed my breakfast every moring. The hotel is small,so is kind nice quite and not too crowdy. The famous Dubai spicy souk, gold souk is in walk distance,even Dubai creek, water Taxi is not far away too. If you take water Taxi only need $1del, then can cross the creek, go to other side, easy walk to Old souk and Dubai Museum. The airport pick up and breakfast was included my stay, so thats nice too.The train staion only few minutes away, is a great way to take the train go to Dubai mall or most other famous tours place. Show more Lanzhi , United States Gold Plaza Guest House 3 Review score Based on 1 reviews Orient Guest House 7.8 Very good Based on 110 reviews After reading the rest of comments I am going only to point out what has been missed by other reviewers in our opinion: - This guest house is cozy, and indeed a taste of the past, but for 196 USD /night the bathrooms are too "from the past". OLD and malfunctioning. They just cant have those bathrooms, not acceptable at all, more like a very cheap B&B elsewere. - In general terms all services are understaffed, especially the cleaning services. Rooms are not clean, and you really dont feel like walking barefoot...again not acceptable at this price. - All equipment is too old, furniture looks good being antique as it looks, but Tv, lamps, etc dont need to be that ancient, there's almost no light in the rooms! - It needs some of the money being cashed from the expensive fees to be invested back, first of all in AC split units and refrigerators that are not noisy. Guests are faced with the choice between heat or insomnia in the night due to the noise of the AC....sorry to say but again not acceptable. In brief: needs urgent works on the bathrooms, replacing equipment and hiring more cleaning staff. The standards are not met and it is a shame, we wont come back or recommend it unless this changes Show more Javier , Spain Al Dar Darak Marina by Jannah 8.2 Excellent Based on 124 reviews Barjeel Heritage Guesthouse 8.4 Excellent Based on 78 reviews It was really a nice and charming place to stay in Dubai a stark contrast from the skyscraper hotels in downtown. You really get to have a sense of place and culture in Barjeel guesthouse. It is located along the row of traditional houses of the early settlers along the Dubai creek. Also a really a big plus is its proximity to the metro station and bus station,even if you are just sleep walking from your hotel room you'll get to the nearest station. ;p There are souks nearby which is nice to check out,plenty of interesting and traditional finds. Plenty of good eating places that are inexpensive but good. Their rooms are just soo charming and cozy its very spacious. The traditional furniture pieces really add to the experience. Its far enough from the street so you wont hear any vehicular noise but very near the creek which is nice to stroll along specially during night time. The breakfast was ok,just enough to have something in your tummy but please dont expect much. We stayed for 7 nights and 8 days and we truly enjoyed our stay in Barjeel. Even my friend who lives in Dubai was surprised with that charming place she never expected something like it along with its inexpensive rate she even wanted to stay there for a night. Though i have read some reviews that it was a bit tricky to find. We were lucky our cab driver knew where it was. I would definitely stay there again if we visit dubai again and would definitely recommend it. The friendly and accomodating staff Erol and Wyclef were a plus in making our stay hassle free. Especially for Indian / Asian / Veg. people. Lots of shopping places, sight seeing like Burj Khalifa fountain Show, Miracle Garden, Global village, etc. All places are aged person / disabled person friendly. Very good transport facilities. Over all a very nice place to visit. Show more Mankad ,India Whatever you have in mind, can find it in Dubai! from shopping to night entertainment all in one place! AL AUJAN ,Saudi Arabia Città interessante, fatta per il turismo, comoda la metro e i bus per gli spostamenti. ottima per gite nel deserto e sport marittimi salvadori ,Italy Visit Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world. Alternatively, explore Dubai Creek. If you are looking for aviation collectibles, Al Rigga has many airlines' offices. You can hunt for the desired collectibles. Started of just me and my wife, so much to see and do as a couple. now we have a daughter and our holidays have changed as its now more about our daughter enjoying and yet again theres so much for children to see and do. Just cant go wrong with visiting Dubai. Show more Ali ,United Kingdom Lots of impressive shopping but it's expensive compared with Europe. Traditional souks offer regional produce which is exciting. Global village was lovely and a great night out. City is clean and modern with all the frills. Essentially a shopping paradise! Show more Mills ,United Kingdom If you have shopping, if you love the sun and beaches and nice hotels, if you have to get some party out of your system , if you wanna see nice cars, peaceful and respectful local emiraties and last but not least, if you have money to spend pouring outta your poks, this is THE place to go. I'm sure that there could be wonderful hidden treasures and jems off the beaten path, but for a short break, it's just malls, decent food choices, and low-cost workers everywhere. For asians like myself, i find it difficult to make do with the food choice and the huge portion of them. As for shopping at souqs, you can try to bargain. However most of them do hard-selling, so make sure you ask for the price range first before actually browsing through the stuffs. They are generally not good in customer service though. Hussain ,Maldives Good to travel to Dubai for shopping and also warm and sunny weather during the month of Nov to March. ..can enjoy the swimming and beach life.Safari, Tower Khalifa, Maria, Dubai Mall, Emirates Dubai Mall. and Dubai Meusum. Abdul Rahman ,Singapore Very lovely city . however always very busy not but not that much traffic jam . the people are friendly. good & safe please to for business, shopping & enjoy the natural life like lovely sandy beaches & desert especially in winter . Show more Ahmed ,United Arab Emirates This is one of the best cities in the world. It's very, very safe for you and your kids, the people are friendly and there is a rule of law. I like the the powers to be have control and the laws are enforced. You don't have to worry about major crime. If you do what they tell you to do, all will be good. The police in this country are still police and not puppets of crime bosses and the government. The government make laws, they stick to it and the police enforce them. This is a country that works. I love this place and will move here as soon as i can. I want to setup a business here. Very friendly to businesses. Show more Ellis ,South Africa There is a lot of promotional noise made about Dubai but after making multiple visit to the city I still really don't know why. It has a fantastic airport and good taxi, the hotels are of a very good standard and typically Filipino and Indian staff are very good. One can find very good food, though typically quite expensive and the shopping in a few of the malls can be quite good but also quite expensive. However, the city is poorly planned and very spread out, its really quite time consuming to get from one place to the other and there is very little in the way of public parks or outdoor spaces. There is no apparent centre to the city, there is apparently no place the people really congregate and hence the city really seems to lack any soul. Show more Davy ,United Kingdom Dubai is a city of multicultural business place. only business can work. people talk in terms of money and rate you accordingly. Dubai city is built with different skill sets of people selectively chosen from all parts of the world keeping in mind only Business. Show more Reddy ,Kenya I found Dubai overrated, with insane traffic, high prices and dirty, hazy air that ruins all the scenery. The high fee to go to the 124th floor observation deck of the Burj Khalifa is a waste of money. The haze means only the buildings within about two blocks are clearly visible. The Burj Arabia sail shaped hotel is barely visible through the haze and the Palm shaped islands are not visible at all. The same applies to the Modern Architecture tour to Abu Dhabi. A van with small windows meant one could mainly see street level and hazy views through the windshield. I don't recommend the area to any one. Show more Anshin ,United States Dubai is business city with amazing architecture and would be a great city to live weather is too hot SURJATI ,Singapore Simply marvelous, at least for a first time visitor. Never seen such an incredible city like this in my life!(I am 58 years old and I have traveled the world)! Ayankogbe ,Nigeria Don't be silly enough to go in July it is too hot to do anything all we wanted to do was stay in the hotel. We even left the water park early despite the fact we paid about $500 plus for our family to enter. 52 degrees celcious was just ridiculously hot couldn't enjoy anything Show more ozturk ,Australia Discover the neighborhoods of Dubai Dubai Marina 1193 hotels Deira 571 hotels Downtown Dubai 527 hotels Palm Jumeirah 448 hotels Bur Dubai 316 hotels Barsha Heights (Tecom) 166 hotels Al Barsha 153 hotels Jumeirah Lakes Towers 142 hotels World Trade Centre DIFC 133 hotels Jumeirah Beach 125 hotels Business Bay 121 hotels Dubailand 99 hotels Sheikh Zayed Road 55 hotels Dubai International Airport 51 hotels Al Jaddaf 46 hotels Jebel Ali 43 hotels Jumeirah 5 hotels Dubai Festival City 4 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Dubai 1792 Serviced Apartments in Dubai 136 Resorts in Dubai 30 Guest Houses in Dubai 15 Hostels in Dubai 13 Capsule Hotels in Dubai 1 More about Dubai With soaring skyscrapers, massive artificial islands, and the only seven-star hotel in the world, Dubai is certainly a city that consistently redefines luxury. The Burj Khalifa has secured this city's status as a global trend-setter, and at nearly half a mile tall and shattering every world record, it is of course the tallest building in the world. Besides luxury accommodation, Dubai is also home to world-class shopping inside some of the most decadent shopping centers in the world. The Dubai Shopping Festival is held during the first two months of the year, and the shopping malls and local markets offer promotions to encourage shoppers. West of the gleaming heights of modern Dubai are Bur Dubai and Deira, historic districts straddling Dubai Creek , where life still reflects some of traditional Dubai. Several of the best hotels in Dubai are housed here in heritage buildings along the creek and around the wharf, with water taxis ferrying passengers between sites like the Bastakiya historic quarter and the Dubai Museum . Dubai International Airport is the busiest travel hub in the Middle East, and it ushers an ever-growing number of tourists into Dubai each year. Find out where the hotels, attractions, and must-see destinations of Dubai are located by exploring the interactive map on this page.
